# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is the Julia code that solves this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end

println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Outputs "my_column"
```

In this function, `replace` is used to replace any sequence of spaces and hyphens with an underscore. The regular expression `r"[\s-]+"` matches one or more spaces or hyphens. `strip(col)` removes leading and trailing whitespaces from the column name. `lowercase(col)` converts the column name to lower case.
